CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 16, 1954, pg. 16, reads: "'Aida' Makes Curtain - 'Aida,' presented by the National Negro Opera Foundation, Inc., and its Pittsburgh Opera Guild, at Syria Mosque Saturday night overcame difficulties and answered critics of the effort by giving a commendable performance. It was a tribute to Mme. Mary Dawson, founder and organizer of the NNOF, and her associates...Muriel Rahn, who sang the title role of 'Aida.'"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Muriel Rahn wearing Egyptian costume, standing in interior of Syria Mosque for National Negro Opera Company performance of "Aida"
